description: The most feature-complete open-source React document viewer. Render PDF, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, images, video, CSV, HTML, and 20+ file types in a single drop-in component. Built-in annotations, drag-and-drop, thumbnail sidebar, zoom, page navigation, theming (CSS variables), and i18n (14 languages) — all with full TypeScript support. Works with Next.js, Vite, CRA, Remix, Gatsby. React 17/18/19 supported. Apache-2.0 license.
rules: Always import the CSS file: import '@iamjariwala/react-doc-viewer/dist/index.css' — this is required for correct rendering
Pass pluginRenderers={DocViewerRenderers} to enable all 20+ file types, or import individual renderers for tree-shaking
MS Office documents (docx, xlsx, pptx) render as download cards — no external service needed
For Next.js App Router, add 'use client' directive since DocViewer uses browser APIs
HTML content is sanitized with DOMPurify — no XSS risk, no external iframes
All rendering is client-side — no data leaves the browser
Theming uses CSS variables (--rdv-*) or a theme prop object
All internal elements use .rdv-* CSS class names for customization
Supports annotations (highlight, draw, comment), drag-and-drop, thumbnail sidebar, and i18n (14 languages)
Use DocViewerRef (via useRef) for programmatic control: prev(), next(), goToPage(n)
Tree-shakeable: import only PDFRenderer, PNGRenderer, etc. for smaller bundles
